Control Name: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems).
Control Description: Control who has access to your systems and what they can do.

Control Name: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.
Control Description: Restrict user actions to only those necessary for their job.

Control Name: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external information systems.
Control Description: Manage connections to systems outside your control.

Control Name: Separate duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.
Control Description: Divide critical tasks among different people to prevent fraud or misuse.

Control Name: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.
Control Description: Grant users and processes only the necessary privileges to do their jobs.

Control Name: Use non-privileged accounts or roles when accessing nonsecurity functions.
Control Description: Donâ€™t use powerful accounts for everyday tasks to limit potential damage.

Control Name: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions and capture the execution of such functions in audit logs.
Control Description: Regular users should not be able to do administrator tasks.
Protect against attackers repeatedly trying to guess passwords.

Control Name: Provide privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules.
Control Description: Inform users of the rules and restrictions for using systems with CUI.

Control Name: Use session lock with pattern-hiding displays to prevent access and viewing of data after a period of inactivity.
Control Description: Quickly lock your screen to prevent unauthorized access.

Control Name: Terminate (automatically) a user session after a defined condition.
Control Description: Log users off automatically after a certain condition (e.g. inactivity).
Keep an eye on who is connecting to your network remotely.

Control Name: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of remote access sessions.
Control Description: Use encryption to protect remote access connections.

Control Name: Route remote access via managed access control points.
Control Description: Control remote access through a limited number of points.

Control Name: Authorize remote execution of privileged commands and remote access to security-relevant information.
Control Description: Control the use of powerful commands and sensitive information remotely.

Control Name: Authorize wireless access prior to allowing such connections.
Control Description: Control the use of wireless networks and devices.

Control Name: Protect wireless access using authentication and encryption.
Control Description: Secure wireless connections with strong passwords and encryption.
Manage the use of mobile devices like phones and tablets.

Control Name: Encrypt CUI on mobile devices and mobile computing platforms.
Control Description: Protect CUI on mobile devices with encryption.

Control Name: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external systems.
Control Description: Manage connections between your network and external systems.

Control Name: Limit use of portable storage devices on external systems.
Control Description: Control the use of portable storage devices like USB drives.

Control Name: Control CUI posted or processed on publicly accessible systems.
Control Description: Safeguard CUI on public systems.

Control Name: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities and of the applicable policies, standards, and procedures related to the security of those systems.
Control Description: Train staff on security awareness and their roles.

Control Name: Ensure that personnel are trained to carry out their assigned information security-related duties and responsibilities.
Control Description: Provide role-based training to staff.

Control Name: Provide security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.
Control Description: Train staff on insider threat awareness.

Control Name: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity.
Control Description: Create and keep audit logs.

Control Name: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable for their actions.
Control Description: Trace user actions for accountability.
Regularly check and update what events are being logged.

Control Name: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.
Control Description: Set up alerts for audit log failures.

Control Name: Correlate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes for investigation and response to indications of unlawful, unauthorized, suspicious, or unusual activity.
Control Description: Analyze audit records for signs of suspicious activity.

Control Name: Provide audit record reduction and report generation to support on-demand analysis and reporting.
Control Description: Make audit records easier to analyze and report on.

Control Name: Provide a system capability that compares and synchronizes internal system clocks with an authoritative source to generate time stamps for audit records.
Control Description: Synchronize system clocks with an accurate time source.

Control Name: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
Control Description: Secure audit logs and tools.

Control Name: Limit management of audit logging functionality to a subset of privileged users.
Control Description: Restrict access to audit log management functions.
Regularly assess security controls to ensure they are effective.

Control Name: Develop and implement a plan of action.
Control Description: Create and implement plans to fix security issues.
Continuously monitor security controls.

Control Name: Develop and update a system security plan.
Control Description: Create and maintain a system security plan.

Control Name: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems (including hardware, software, firmware, and documentation) throughout the respective system development life cycles.
Control Description: Establish and maintain secure configurations.

Control Name: Establish and enforce security configuration settings for information technology products employed in organizational systems.
Control Description: Set and enforce secure configurations for IT products.

Control Name: Track, review, approve or disapprove, and log changes to organizational systems.
Control Description: Manage changes to systems.

Control Name: Analyze the security impact of changes prior to implementation.
Control Description: Review changes for security impacts.

Control Name: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to organizational systems.
Control Description: Control access to systems during changes.

Control Name: Employ the principle of least functionality by configuring organizational systems to provide only essential capabilities.
Control Description: Use the principle of least functionality.

Control Name: Restrict, disable, or prevent the use of nonessential programs, functions, ports, protocols, and services.
Control Description: Limit unnecessary programs and services.

Control Name: Apply deny-by-exception (blacklisting) policy to prevent the use of unauthorized software or deny-all, permit-by-exception (whitelisting) policy to allow the execution of authorized software.
Control Description: Use blacklisting or whitelisting to control software execution.
Manage user-installed software.

Control Name: Identify system users, processes acting on behalf of users, and devices.
Control Description: Assign unique IDs to users, processes, and devices.

Control Name: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of those users, processes, or devices, as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational systems.
Control Description: Verify identities before granting access.

Control Name: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.
Control Description: Use multiple authentication factors.

Control Name: Employ replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for network access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.
Control Description: Use authentication methods that resist replay attacks.

Control Name: Prevent reuse of identifiers for a defined period.
Control Description: Don't reuse user IDs for a certain time.
Disable inactive user IDs.
Use strong passwords.
Don't reuse old passwords.
Use passwords that are valid for only one login session or a short period of time.
Store passwords securely.
Hide passwords and other authentication information.
Develop a plan for responding to security incidents.
Report security incidents to the appropriate people.
Regularly test your incident response plan.
Regularly maintain your systems.
Manage the tools used for maintenance.
Clean or destroy media before reusing or discarding it.
Check media for malicious code before using it.

Control Name: Use multi-factor authentication for remote maintenance.
Control Description: Use strong authentication for remote maintenance sessions.
Supervise maintenance activities.
Protect the confidentiality of CUI.
Limit access to CUI to authorized users.
Clean or destroy media containing CUI before disposal or reuse.
Mark media containing CUI with appropriate labels.
Control access to media containing CUI.
Encrypt CUI on portable storage devices.
Control the use of removable media.
Do not allow the use of portable storage devices that have no identifiable owner.
Protect the confidentiality of CUI backups.
Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and operating environments to authorized individuals.
Monitor physical access to facilities and infrastructure.
Escort visitors and monitor their activity.
Keep records of physical access.
Control and manage physical access devices.
Enforce safeguards for CUI at alternate work sites.
Screen individuals before allowing them access to CUI.
Protect CUI when employees are terminated or transferred.
Regularly assess risk to organizational operations, assets, and individuals.
Regularly scan for vulnerabilities in systems and applications.
Fix vulnerabilities based on risk assessments.
Protect the confidentiality of CUI.
Use secure design principles when building and updating systems.
Separate user functions from system management functions.
Prevent unauthorized information transfer via shared system resources.
Use separate subnetworks for publicly accessible systems.
Block network traffic by default and allow only authorized traffic.
Prevent remote devices from connecting to both internal and external networks simultaneously.
Encrypt CUI during transmission.
End network connections after a period of inactivity.
Establish and manage cryptographic keys.
Use FIPS-validated cryptography to protect CUI.
Control and monitor the use of collaborative computing devices.
Control and monitor the use of mobile code.
Control and monitor the use of Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technologies.
Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.
Protect the confidentiality of CUI at rest.
Identify, report, and correct system flaws.
Identify malicious code.
Isolate malicious code.
Remove malicious code.
Report malicious code.
Update malicious code protection mechanisms.
Monitor for malicious code.
